fields.description:
An "add space" link may appear if the Confluence instance retains the default content with the four "Get started" steps.

If a user without create space permission clicks this link, they will get presented with the "Add Space" dialog. They will then take the trouble of creating a valid space name only to find that they do not have permission to perform this action.

The Create Space dialog should not appear in the first place for these users. The "No permission" page should be thrown when the user clicks on the rogue link.
fields.summary: Add space dialog not show if user does not have permission to add spaces

fields.description:
This is a regression for CONF-23149, occurring in 4.2.x. The Content by Label macro does not sort ASCII characters properly.


*Steps to reproduce*

# Create three new pages with the following titles, each labeled as *umlaut*:
#- "Ü - Pagetitle beginning with Ü"
#- "T - Pagetitle beginning with T"
#- "V - Pagetitle beginning with V"
# Create another new page titled "Test Macro" and add "Content by Label" macro. Type "umlaut" as the label and sort it by "title"


By viewing the page "Test Macro", the macro displays the page "Ü - Pagetitle beginning with Ü" at the bottom of the list. The correct sorting for this macro should be in the middle of the list (i.e. the page "Ü - Pagetitle beginning with Ü" would be between "T - Pagetitle beginning with T" and "V - Pagetitle beginning with V").
fields.summary: [Regression] contentbylabel macro does not sort ASCII characters properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26297].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create page A
2. Create page B, a child of A
3. Create page C, a child of B
4. Apply Restrictions (E.g. view restrictions) to A.

So it should look like this:

A <-- restricted 
\|_ B 
\|___C

Now delete page A.

Expected: B and C should remain with in hierarchy with restrictions still applied.

Outcome: Restrictions are moved from B and C

If a parent page with restrictions is deleted, the same restrictions should be applied to the first level of children under the parent that was just deleted. 

Tested and can reproduce in Confluence 4.2.x and 4.3
fields.summary: Deleting a parent page makes all child pages move into the root and any inherited page restrictions are removed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26296].
  {panel}

A Confluence backed by MS SQL Server can run into deadlocking problems when not using transaction isolation level 'Read Committed with Row Versioning'. This often occurs silently without warning in Confluence logs:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-21986
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-22302
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Database+Deadlock+on+Microsoft+SQL+Server
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/UPM+Cannot+be+Upgraded
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Confluence+Hangs+When+Trying+to+Add+or+Manage+Users


To the observer, the symptom is that the application 'hangs', with or without errors in the Confluence logs. In the case of an upgrade, when observing the logs an upgrade task will be seemingly 'stuck' and refuse to proceed (no errors).

We should check for DB transaction isolation level during start up and print an error/warning in the logs if not using the recommended isolation. We can also go one step further and prevent the application from starting, like we do for MySQL if they're not using READ-COMMITTED.
fields.summary: When using MS SQL Server, Check for 'Read-Committed with Row Versioning' transaction isolation during startup/upgrades

fields.description:
When attempting to edit an .XLSX file in Open Office, using Firefox v14.0.1, the application launches and then fails with a 500 Internal Server Error before opening the file when Confluence is running on SSL. 

Similar behaviour can also be observed in OS X with Firefox v13.0.1 but in this instance there is no error, the application just doesn't launch and there appears to be no response at all.

This issue does not occur when the instance is not running on SSL, (i.e. http).
fields.summary: Edit in Office fails with 500 error in Firefox on OS X when Confluence is running on https

fields.description:
We use Crowd for user management. I have created a group and added some users to the group. Then I have assicated to the group to the confluence application as well in crowd. But when I try to use this newly created group to retrict a particular page in confluence, the application searches the new group and lists but after selecting, I get a error message stating Unknown user or group. 

I have followed the same procedure for other groups and are working fine. I would like to know if there is a time frame after creating a new group in crowd , for the group to reflect in Confluence. 

Also, please let me know if there is any restriction with the number of groups that can be used in confluence. Right now, there are close to 50 groups and we would like to create more groups.

Thanks,
Dinesh 
Fidelity Investments.
fields.summary: Could not associate a newly created group in Page restriction under Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26289].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to Reproduce
Let's say we have a user called userX and userY
# Create a new page titled PageA
# Add some content and mention @userX in the page
# Save the page
# UserX will receive a mention notification email
# Edit PageA
# Mention @userY 
# Mention @userX
# Save the page
# UserY will receive a mention notification email
# UserX will *not* receive a mention notification email

I'm not sure if this is by design that one user, would get only, one mention notification email, per one single content object (page/comment/blogpost). If so, I'd think this would fall under improvement rather than a bug, but we should clarify further about it in [its doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Using+Mentions].


{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of February 14, 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi All,

Thank you for your feedback on this issue thus far. This behaviour is currently by design. Due to the ongoing interest in this, the issue has been moved from a Bug to Suggestion to continue to track your feedback.

It is also worth pointing out that this behaviours does not apply to tasks. If a task [] is created on a page with an @mention, the user WILL receive a task notification email.

Confluence Product Management

{panel}
fields.summary: Mention @user email notification on EDIT page/comment will not be sent if the user has been mentioned previously in the same page

fields.description:
h3.Problem Description
Despite the timezone of server and the user is not in UTC or GMT+0, somehow the RSS feed generated will take UTC as its timezone.

h3.Steps to reproduce
# Set the Server time to other than UTC
!rss-servertz.png!
# Set the user's timezone other than UTC as well.
!rss-usertz.png!
# Check the time on the page creation from Confluence. In this example the local time of page creation was *11:23am*
# Click on Browse - Feed Builder
# Build an RSS feed.
# Click on the feed link and open the URL so you can see the XML. Updates and Published times are in the wrong timezone:
{code}
<entry>
    <title>rss</title>
    <link rel="alternate" href="http://localhost:10432/display/CAT2/rss" />
    <author>
      <name>admin</name>
    </author>
    <id>tag:localhost,2009:page-917515-3</id>
    <updated>2012-10-17T00:22:07Z</updated>
    <published>2012-10-17T00:22:07Z</published>
{code}
fields.summary: RSS feed time always generated with UTC timezone

fields.description:
This bug only happens with firefox. Tested on versions 14 and 15 beta.
The behavior cannot be replicated on IE or Chrome.

When adding a new row on a table with a lot of content (500x4), firefox gets slow and shows the following Javascript error:

{noformat}
A script on this page may be busy, or it may have stopped responding. You can stop the script now, or you can continue to see if the script will complete.

Script: https://127.0.0.1:8444/confluence/s/en_GB/3281/20/e057e0bc4cec8ae164a31b164cb12cff/_/download/contextbatch/js/editor,macro-browser/batch.js:95 
{noformat}

After clicking on Continue two times, the row is been added.

A workaround is to increase the time on dom.max_script_run_time property on Firefox. However this workaround just avoid the error to be shown but the delay will continue.
fields.summary: Adding a new row at the bottom of a table with a lot of rows causes firefox/javascript hang issue

fields.description:
Hi! 
I'm having a problem where the notification key binding events doesn't seem to unbind when I exit or close the notification window using the escape key. 
My problem is that when I do this, followed by pressing the enter-key, the window is re-opened. This creates a problem where other elements could be selected, but the enter-key would still open the notification window. 

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the notification window on the dashboard using the keyboard shortcut ('g' then 'n').
2. Close the window by pressing the esc-key. 
3. Press the enter-key - the notification window reopens.
fields.summary: Notification keyboard shortcut doesn't unbind key event on esc

fields.description:

The page-editor.js makes use of a method called Confluence.Editor.addErrorMessage() which relies on the following structure being in the DOM - {code}
...snip...
...snip...
...snip...
{code} Neither the comment editor or the new quick-comment editor have this structure present and so any reported messages would be lost. The only message currently being lost (disregarding anything external plugins might do) is an error on trying to preview content.
fields.summary: The comment editor does not include the necessary div to show editor related error messages

fields.description:
When creating or editing a page in Confluence v3.5.16/v3.5.17 in IE7, the Office Connector, (bundled version 2.0.13_backport), throws the following Java Script error:

AJS.Confluence.PropertyPanel.Macro is null or undefined

This version was released as part of the security advisory and therefore there is no further upgrade path for these customers.

*Workaround:* At this stage the only workaround is to downgrade the Office Connector to v1.18, but this is not advisable for anyone who's instance is accessible to the internet or available for public signup because this would expose the security vulnerability to any logged in user. However, this workaround would work for anyone who is using their Confluence internally and can trust their users.

Related Office Connector issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/OFFCONN-89
fields.summary: The Office Connector causes a Java Script error in Internet Explorer 7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26227].
  {panel}

I got a similar problem to CONF-25599: on our 4.2.11-test-system images from {{\{include\}}}d-pages are no longer exported to word-documents or linked to a web-path; instead they contain paths like "C:\attach_5a03ccfa4507e2ae469056e46e25425b"-which of course won't work.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create page "A"
2. Create page "B" as a sub-page of page "A"
3. Edit page "B" to include an image
4. Edit page "A" to {{\{include\}}} page "B"
5. Export page "A" as word document
fields.summary: Word-Export does not include images from included pages

fields.description:
Normally, the 'insert table' drop down will be shown beneath the table button -
!table-drop-down-correct.png!

However, in the quick-comment editor the drop down is shown over the top of the table button -
!table-drop-down-incorrect.png!

I've raised this as major even though it is basically cosmetic. The reason is that this is preventing us from running any of the the table-picker tests on our Quick Comment automated builds so potentially hiding other failures now or in the future.

When this is fixed then the exclusion on the table-picker-test should be removed from {{com.atlassian.confluence.qunit.QUnitQuickCommentEditorWebDriverTestSuite}}

I should note that the 'insert' menu drop down does not suffer from this problem.
fields.summary: The table drop-down is positioned over the button instead of beneath it using the quick comment editor

fields.description:
On the "import word document" page action the name of the confluence page is a persistent xss vector (as it is not encoded).

How to Reproduce:

1. Create a confluence page with the following title
{noformat}
XSS"/><script>alert('XSS')</script>
{noformat}

2. Navigate to the created page
3. Under the tools menu select "Import Word Document"
4. Upload a  word document
5. Click "Next"
6. See an alert prompt containing the text 'XSS' within it.
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in the "import word document" page action through the page name

fields.description:
You cannot link to an attachment attached to a space _(and if it has already been indexed)_. Attachments can be added to a space using WebDAV and/or by uploading a space logo.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a space (in this example I'll call it HyperSpace)
# Go to the newly created space, set a custom logo for it
# Navigate to Confluence Admin and rebuild your content index, to make sure the modifications get indexed
# Create a new page, start typing '[' then the space key, in this case HYP. The space logo attachment should show (it's name after the space key). Select the attachment and insert the link
!space-logo.png! (Same issue will occur for attachments uploaded to space directory using WebDAV and then referenced in the editor)
# Try saving or previewing the page and you will face an error:
!Preview.png!
!Save.png!
{quote}
The following error(s) occured: There was an error loading preview, please try again later.
HTTP Status 412 - Precondition Failed
{quote} 
Or in Confluence 5.1, you get the following error instead:
!logo.jpg!

{quote}
The following error(s) occurred:

    Failure when converting editor format to storage format.
{quote}

In _atlassian-confluence.log_ you will find exceptions like:

{code}An error occurred while unmarshalling a link in the editor with the title <SPACE TITLE>{code}

{code}Error creating resource identifier for resource Attachment ...{code}

{code}com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: RuntimeException occurred while transforming editor format to storage format (com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: An error occurred while unmarshalling a link in the editor with the title <SPACE KEY/NAME>{code}

*Workaround*

Do not insert links referencing attachments attached to a space. You can check which attachments are attached to a space by going to Space Tools > Content Tools > Attachments and looking at the Attached To column

!Screen Shot 2013-08-09 at 10.04.46 AM.png!
fields.summary: Cannot link to attachments attached to a space

value of attribute "ALIGN" cannot be "ABSMIDDLE"; must be one of "TOP", "MIDDLE", "BOTTOM", "LEFT", "RIGHT"

fields.description: When exporting to HTML a page that contains an occurrence of the expand macro, no ALT attribute is defined for the arrow images (class of expand-control-image). This causes the page to fail W3C validation against the 4.01 Transitional standard as ALT is a required attribute.

fields.description:
Hi

I can't login in Confluence with Internet Explorer 9 on my local pc or from another pc.
Chrome or firefox don't have this problem.

I go to the login address and enter my credentials. I always see the same login screen again. 

I even tried to change the security settings in Internet Explorer, so I found on the internet (same problems, but with Jira, but it won't work for me.

I changed Security -> Local Internet -> Custom Level -> User Authentication to  Anonymous logon. But with no result.
Even after a restart of IE and my computer.

Any ideas?

Thx
Karel
fields.summary: Login problems Confluence with Internet Explorer 9
